content:
2014-10-30T01:04:52Zhttp://zenodo.org/oai2d oai:zenodo.org:123842014-10-27T18:16:38Zuser-coaruser-zenodoopenaire McCutcheon, Valerie Nixon, William Repository Profile: University of Glasgow: "Enlighten" IR & Research System. COAR Repository Observatory 2014-10-16 cc-by http://zenodo.org/record/12384 doi:10.5281/zenodo.12384

The University of Glasgow has established the “Enlighten” IR and Research system. The IR holds 72,000 items for institutional peer-reviewed journal articles, published conference papers, books and book chapters.

The Research System is an in-house-built system holding research information for institutional research activity, including people, organisations, projects and outputs. It is dynamically linked to the Enlighten IR.

info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess info:eu-repo/semantics/article oai:zenodo.org:124752014-10-29T15:19:00Zopenaireuser-coar Ribeiro, Lígia Maria Repository Profile: Repository and CRIS at the University of Porto. COAR Repository Observatory 2014-10-16 cc-by http://zenodo.org/record/12475 doi:10.5281/zenodo.12475

At the University of Porto (U.Porto) both repository and CRIS are being used as part of the local e-infrastructure. U.Porto Open Repository is the largest institutional repository on RCAAP, the Portuguese Open Access Scientific Repository, hosting 32.616 full text CC-BY works as of September 2014.

SIGARRA-CRIS and U.Porto Open Repository are interoperable. When on the SIGARRA-CRIS the full text of a publication is registered and available on a CC BY basis both the corresponding metadata and the digital object are automatically transferred to the U.Porto Open Repository.

info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess info:eu-repo/semantics/article oai:zenodo.org:124772014-10-29T15:19:00Zopenaireuser-coar Moreira, João Repository Profile: RCAAP & PTCRIS. COAR Repository Observatory 2014-10-16 cc-by http://zenodo.org/record/12477 doi:10.5281/zenodo.12477

RCAAP (Repositório Cientifico de Acesso Aberto de Portugal) is the main instrument for open access development in Portugal. It is a national open access initiative with 42 Institutional Repositories, one shared repository with 30 institutions, 30 Scientific journals and ore than 185.000 OA docs.

PTCRIS is a program that aims to ensure the creation and sustained development of a national integrated information ecosystem (PTCRIS) to support research management.

info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess info:eu-repo/semantics/article
